intro: Lachnosiphonium rude, commonly known as the rough lachnosiphonium, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions. The plant has a thalloid structure, with a leafy, flattened body that is often covered in small, scale-like structures. Its reproductive structures, called sporophytes, are borne on specialized stems and produce spores for propagation. Lachnosiphonium rude plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
